timeline.bodyText: it is better to throw MQClientException
timeline.author: jixuan1989

replies.bodyText: The  MessageListenerOrderly interface doesn't allow to throw an exception
replies.author: qiaojialin

timeline.author: jixuan1989

timeline.bodyText: so, only keep the final message?
timeline.author: jixuan1989

replies.bodyText: Yes, the more detailed message could be found in the result.
replies.author: qiaojialin

timeline.bodyText: overhead if all are successful. (too many TSStatus instances.. right?)
timeline.author: jixuan1989

replies.bodyText:
Yes, I create a public static TSStatus SUCCESS_STATUS = new TSStatus(TSStatusCode.SUCCESS_STATUS.getStatusCode());
in RpcUtils and reuse this.
replies.author: qiaojialin

timeline.bodyText: do we really need such a long string as the message?

replies.bodyText: This message is not needed, removed
